title: DNA-30: Fix installer escape codes and flow
description:
## Bug
Escape codes printed literally instead of rendering:
```
After installation, use \033[1m/dna-extractor\033[0m in Claude Code.
```

## Additional Issues
1. Flow is redundant - asks reinstall, then explains, then asks proceed, then asks location again
2. Should use `echo -e` or `printf` for escape codes, or just avoid them

## Expected
- Bold text renders correctly OR just use plain text
- Streamlined flow: detect existing → explain → confirm once → execute

## Reproduce
```
./install.sh
```

## Definition of Done
- [ ] No literal escape codes in output
- [ ] Single confirmation flow (not 3 prompts)
- [ ] Works on macOS and Linux (bash + zsh)
close_reason: Fixed escape codes with echo -e, streamlined to single confirmation (up-to-date exits silently, changes need one prompt), tested on bash

title: DNA-29: Interactive installer with confirmation
description:
## Description
Rewrite install.sh to be interactive and user-friendly:

1. **Explain** - Print what the installer will do before doing anything
2. **Permission** - Ask user for explicit permission to proceed
3. **Auto-detect** - Detect installation location (~/.claude/skills/ or similar)
4. **Confirm** - Show detected location, let user confirm or override
5. **Execute** - Perform the installation
6. **Idempotent** - Safe to run multiple times (check existing, update if needed)

## Example Flow
```
DNA Extractor Installer
=======================

This will:
  - Create symlink at ~/.claude/skills/dna-extractor.md
  - Point to: /path/to/dna-extractor/skills/dna-extractor.md

Detected install location: ~/.claude/skills/
Proceed? [Y/n]: 

Installing... done.
Run: /dna-extractor --help
```

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Explains actions before executing
- [ ] Asks for user permission (Y/n prompt)
- [ ] Auto-detects ~/.claude/skills/ or falls back to ~/.local/share/claude/skills/
- [ ] Shows detected location and asks for confirmation
- [ ] Handles existing installation (update/skip)
- [ ] Idempotent - running twice produces same result
- [ ] Clear success/error messages
- [ ] Works on macOS and Linux
close_reason: Closed

- Output shapes: success/error responses with status codes

title: DNA-28: Consolidate CLAUDE.md into AGENTS.md

Reference style: https://github.com/steipete/agent-scripts/blob/main/AGENTS.MD
- Telegraph style; noun-phrases ok; drop grammar; min tokens
- Action-oriented, quick-scanning format
- Minimal prose, maximum density

## Deliverables

- Delete CLAUDE.md after merge

## Definition of Done
- [ ] All essential info from CLAUDE.md preserved
- [ ] Follows steipete telegraph style (terse, noun-phrases, minimal grammar)
- [ ] CLAUDE.md deleted
- [ ] AGENTS.md is the single source of project conventions
close_reason: Closed

title: DNA-32: Reorganize DNA template for human-first reading
description:
## Problem
Current DNA output buries what humans/agents care about most. Technical details come before user value.

## New Section Order (top to bottom)

1. **Identity** - name, purpose, one-liner
2. **Primary User Stories** (NEW) - 2-4 key stories in format:
   "As a [user], I want [feature], so that [benefit]"
3. **Capabilities** - what the system does (MOVED UP)
4. **Stack** - languages, frameworks, key deps (MOVED UP)
5. **Operations** - CI/CD, build, deploy (MOVED UP)
6. **Feature List** (NEW) - condensed from remaining user stories
   - Group similar features ("CRUD operations", "image manipulation", etc)
   - Cap at 30-40 items max, consolidate if more
7. **Architecture** - patterns, structure
8. **Domain Model** - entities, relationships
9. **Conventions** - coding standards
10. **Constraints** - limitations
11. **Uncertainties** - gaps, questions

## Deliverables
- Update templates/dna-template.md with new order
- Update prompts/phase3/dna-renderer.md with reorg hints
- Add user story extraction to phase2 prompts (or new prompt)
- Add feature consolidation logic to renderer

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Template reflects new section order
- [ ] Primary User Stories section with 2-4 stories
- [ ] Feature List section with smart grouping
- [ ] Renderer prompt knows to consolidate 30+ features
- [ ] Stack and CI/CD appear in top half
- [ ] Capabilities before Architecture
close_reason: Reorganized DNA template for human-first reading. New order: Identity → User Stories → Capabilities → Stack → Operations → Feature List → Architecture → Domain Model → Conventions → Constraints → Uncertainties. Added user story extraction and feature consolidation (30+ threshold) logic.

title: DNA-35: Add user story extraction prompt
description:
## Problem
DNA output has great technical detail but missing:
- Why does this project exist?
- Who uses it?
- What problems does it solve for them?

The sample DNA for mcp_agent_mail has 1000+ lines of technical detail but zero user stories.

## Solution
Create a new Phase 2 prompt: **user-story-extractor.md**

### Sources to Mine
1. **README.md** - "Why" section, introduction, motivation
2. **docs/** - User guides, tutorials, getting started
3. **GitHub Issues** - Feature requests reveal user needs
4. **Code comments** - "This allows users to..." patterns
5. **CLI --help** - Command descriptions imply use cases
6. **Test names** - "test_user_can_..." patterns

### Extraction Logic
1. Look for explicit user mentions ("users can", "developers need", "allows teams to")
2. Infer personas from features (CLI = developer, Web UI = end user, API = integrator)
3. Convert features to stories: "send_message tool" → "As an agent, I want to send messages to other agents, so that we can coordinate work"

### Output Format
```yaml
user_stories:
  primary:  # 2-4 most important
    - persona: AI coding agent
      want: send messages to other agents
      benefit: coordinate file access and avoid conflicts
    - persona: DevOps engineer
      want: monitor agent communication
      benefit: debug multi-agent workflows
  secondary:  # condensed feature list
    - "CRUD operations on messages (send, read, search, archive)"
    - "File reservation system (lock, release, check conflicts)"
    - "Cross-project contact management"
```

## Definition of Done
- [ ] prompts/phase2/user-story-extractor.md created
- [ ] Extracts 2-4 primary user stories with persona/want/benefit
- [ ] Generates condensed feature list from remaining capabilities
- [ ] Orchestrator includes user-story-extractor in Phase 2
- [ ] dna-renderer places user stories after Identity section
- [ ] Test on mcp_agent_mail produces meaningful stories
close_reason: Created user-story-extractor.md prompt that mines README, docs/, CLI help, test names, and code comments to extract 2-4 primary user stories plus condensed feature inventory. Updated orchestrator and dna-renderer.

title: DNA-23: Multi-repo testing
description:
## Description
Test against specific diverse repos to validate portability across tech stacks and scales.

## Test Repositories

| Repo | Tech Stack | Scale | Purpose |
|------|------------|-------|---------|
| `rickgorman/claude-sandbox` | Mixed | Small | Primary test target, familiar baseline |
| `rickgorman/sunlink` | Ruby/Rails | Medium | Rails app extraction validation |
| `dicklesworthstone/beads_viewer` | Python | Large (~500k LoC) | Scale stress test, large codebase handling |

## Deliverables
- DNA.md output for each repository
- Comparative analysis report
- Performance notes (time taken, memory usage for large repo)

## Definition of Done
- [ ] claude-sandbox: extraction completes, DNA captures key characteristics
- [ ] sunlink: Rails-specific patterns extracted (models, routes, concerns)
- [ ] beads_viewer: extraction completes within reasonable time (<2hrs for comprehensive)
- [ ] beads_viewer: no crashes or memory issues with large codebase
- [ ] All three DNAs have populated Identity, Domain Model, Capabilities sections
- [ ] Document any tech-specific gaps discovered
- [ ] ≥90% confidence extraction works correctly for claude-sandbox
- [ ] ≥85% confidence extraction works correctly for sunlink (Rails)
- [ ] ≥80% confidence extraction handles beads_viewer scale without degradation
- [ ] ≥75% confidence extraction quality is consistent across all three repos
close_reason: Multi-repo testing complete - 3 repos tested successfully

title: Fix install.sh for curl pipe usage
description:
When running 'curl ... | bash', BASH_SOURCE[0] is unbound causing:
bash: line 18: BASH_SOURCE[0]: unbound variable

The script uses 'set -u' and BASH_SOURCE which doesn't work when piped. Need to detect pipe mode and handle differently (e.g., download to temp dir first).
close_reason: Fixed in MR dn-pu6 - install.sh pipe mode

title: DNA-33: Fast intro with phase explanation and project name
description:
## Description
Improve UX by giving immediate feedback before extraction starts.

## Behavior

```
$ /dna-extractor /path/to/myproject --level=standard

DNA Extractor
=============
Scanning: myproject

Phases:
  1. Scout     - structure, config, entry points, schemas
  2. Analyze   - domain, APIs, tests, security, conventions
  3. Synthesize - resolve conflicts, score confidence, render

Starting Phase 1...
```

## Implementation

1. **Fast name check** (no delay):
   - Look for README.md → extract project name from H1 or title
   - Fallback: use folder/repo name
   - Do NOT parse entire repo, just grab name

2. **Phase explanation**:
   - Brief 1-line description of each phase
   - Sets user expectations for wait time

3. **Immediate start**:
   - Print intro, then immediately begin Phase 1
   - No confirmation prompt, no delay

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Project name displayed within 1 second of start
- [ ] Phase overview printed before work begins
- [ ] README H1 extraction works (or graceful fallback)
- [ ] No blocking prompts or delays
- [ ] Works for both local paths and GitHub URLs
close_reason: Added fast intro to dna-extractor command: shows project name (from README H1 or folder), phase overview, then starts immediately. No delays or prompts.

title: DNA-10: Domain modeler

title: DNA-17: Conflict resolver
description:
## Description
Create prompts/phase3/conflict-resolver.md to detect contradictions, apply resolution ladder, flag uncertainties.

## Deliverables
- `prompts/phase3/conflict-resolver.md`

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Detects contradictory findings from different agents
- [ ] Applies resolution ladder: specificity > code over docs > tests as tiebreaker > recency > explicit over inferred
- [ ] Escalates unresolvable conflicts to "uncertain" with both findings
- [ ] Merges corroborating findings (increases confidence)
- [ ] Merges complementary findings (different details about same thing)
- [ ] ≥95% confidence corroborating findings are merged correctly
- [ ] ≥90% confidence resolution ladder is applied consistently
- [ ] ≥85% confidence true contradictions are flagged, not false positives
close_reason: Conflict resolver prompt created with detection, resolution ladder, and merge strategies
